Key Match Events: Brandon Marsh cleared the bases with a three-run bomb to the opposite field off Charlie Morton for his 14th homer of the year.
Nick Castellanos smashed a go-ahead two-run homer off Grant Holmes into the trees beyond the center field wall.
Matt Strahm and Jeff Hoffman took it from there, holding the Braves scoreless over the final two innings to preserve the 5-4 victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The showdown between the Philadelphia Phillies and Atlanta Braves was highly anticipated as a pivotal four-game series at Citizens Bank Park.
Post-Match Reflections: The win improved Philadelphia's record to 79-55, six games ahead of second-place Atlanta in the NL East standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Citizens Bank Park in front of a crowd of 40,451.
Others: The Philadelphia Phillies were coming off a brutal 10-0 shutout loss to the Houston Astros the day before.
The two teams will square off again on Friday in a potential pitching duel between All-Stars Reynaldo Lopez (7-4, 2.02 ERA) and Ranger Suarez (11-5, 2.82 ERA).
